message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.MM

This paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it deals with color constancy, which is a fundamental problem in computer vision. The paper also proposes a method to learn the luminance-to-chromaticity classifier using stochastic gradient descent, which is a common technique in machine learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper involves the use of a classifier to identify the true chromaticity of a pixel, which is a common technique in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also involves the analysis of per-pixel color statistics, which is related to the field of graphics (cs.GR). Finally, the paper proposes a method for estimating the scene illuminant, which is related to multimedia (cs.MM).
